metadata.Title: CVE-2011-0343 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Balabit syslog-ng 2.0, 3.0, 3.1, 3.2 OSE and PE, when running on FreeBSD orHP-UX, does not properly perform cast operations, which causes syslog-ng touse a default value of -1 to create log files with insecure permissions(07777), which allows local users to read and write to these log files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-0343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

syslog-ng - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-core - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-amqp - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-geoip - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-json - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-mongodb - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-redis - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-smtp - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-sql - 3.1.3-2
syslog-ng-mod-stomp - 3.1.3-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: syslog-ng package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.3-2').
